content: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Succession planning is a big deal at most public companies. For the first time in 124 years  General Electric's may be determined by dealmaking. As Jeff Immelt nears retirement  the progress of two large acquisitions in the coming year will help guide GE's board on who should get the top job.
name: Synchrony Financial
title: GE's succession path lit by dueling deals
